visualization_prompt: Create a Highcharts chart with a logarithmic Y-axis that allows negative values. The chart should have a spline type, a title 'Logarithmic Axis with Custom Conversion Allows Negative Values', and a single series of data points ranging from negative to positive values. The axes and labels should be styled with specific colors and font sizes. The chart should also have a custom background color and margins.

title.text: Logarithmic Axis with Custom Conversion Allows Negative Values

visualization_explanation: The provided Highcharts configuration renders a spline chart with a logarithmic Y-axis that supports negative values. The chart title is styled with a dark gray color and a font size of 18 pixels. The X-axis is labeled with month names and styled with a medium gray color and a font size of 14 pixels. The Y-axis is logarithmic and includes a custom option to allow negative log values, with labels styled similarly to the X-axis. The single data series ranges from -1000 to 1000, displayed in a teal color. The chart background is light gray, and margins are set to provide ample space around the chart elements. The legend is disabled to simplify the visualization.
